page.title: 02FARMING Gipsey Brige
page.content: The soil structure of the area is of a strong silt, grade 2 as defined by the Min. of Ag. The crops grown are wheat, barley, oats,sugarbeet, rape and peas (for drying)the sugarbeet is contracted out but all the other crops are harvested by the farmers.The farm has 100 cows 'calves which are sent for fattening up for beef.The farmers keep a hundred cattle on the farm, which is 1100 acres. The farmers drain their fields to keep them dry.Every year the drains are checked and new drains are put in where they are needed. Hedges have gone because they spoil the drainage though around the large grass fields some are kept.Some trees have been planted in the spinney. Fertilizers and weedkillers are used and the farmers think them safe if they are used well and not by air.
